title: disability rights bodies slam A Raja
article: disability rights organisations have objected to DMK MP A Raja's remarks equating Sanatan Dharma with HIV and leprosy. The Leprosy Mission Trust India, in a letter to Raja, has asked him to reconsider his statement and "publicly apologise for any harm caused".

title: No lift at Khar office, disabled activist carried up 2 floors to register marriage
article: A disability rights activist in Mumbai had to be carried up two flights of stairs to register her marriage due to the lack of infrastructure for disabled persons in government offices. The incident highlighted the struggles faced by cash-starved PSUs in meeting basic requirements for accessibility. The activist questioned the effectiveness of the Centre's Accessible India campaign. The sub-registrar's office where the incident occurred is in a building belonging to MTNL, which is under dissolution and lacks a working lift. The incident raised discussions on the impact of the term 'divyang' on the lives of disabled citizens.

title: Rajasthan Royals and DCCI set to organise 3rd National Physical disability T20 Cricket Championship
article: The Rajasthan Royals have announced their partnership with the Differently Abled Cricket Council of India (DCCI) to organize the 3rd National Physical disability T20 Cricket Championship. The competition, set to be the largest cricket tournament for physically disabled cricketers, will feature over 400 Divyang cricketers representing 24 state teams. The tournament aims to empower the players and raise awareness about inclusivity in sports. The matches will be held in Udaipur over 11 days, with free entry for spectators. The Royals' CEO expressed their commitment to using cricket for social change, while the DCCI thanked them for their support.

title: Atrocity to confine disabled people at home: Phal Desai
No disability pension for BP issue triggered by obesity: AFT
article: The Armed Forces Tribunal in India has ruled that a soldier with obesity-caused diabetes and hypertension is not eligible for disability pension. The tribunal examined the soldier's Body Mass Index (BMI) and found that he was significantly overweight at the time of discharge from service. T

title: TN’s welfare of differently abled persons dept gets new secretary
Delhi HC to PWD: ‘Even a healthy person can’t use foot bridge, forget disabled’
article: Delhi High Court criticizes the poor condition of foot overbridges (FOBs) in Delhi, stating that they are unusable even for healthy individuals. The court orders the Public Works Department (PWD) to immediately repair over 100 FOBs. The court questions the lack of responsibility and periodic maintenance, and asks if liability has been fixed on erring officials. The PWD assures the court that 110 FOBs will be made fully functional and disabled-friendly by June 30 next year.

title: 2 held for attack on disabled person, son
Mega cricketing event to unfold in holy city of Amritsar
Mumbai airport is 1st in Asia to commission 'Disabled Aircraft Recovery Kit'
article: Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) in Mumbai has become the first airport in Asia to commission a 'Disabled Aircraft Recovery Kit' (DARK). DARK is a facility that can quickly recover large commercial and transport aircraft involved in runway excursions or other incidents. It is a more efficient and faster recovery process compared to conventional methods, requiring fewer trained personnel and occupying a smaller footprint. The CSMIA's Aircraft Rescue and Fire Fighting team underwent a five-day training programme to operate DARK.

title: Here’s how people with disabilities can stay safe online
article: People with disabilities (PWDs) are increasingly being targeted by cyber attacks. Factors contributing to this include their use of assistive technologies, lack of awareness about cyber threats, and targeted phishing attacks. Scammers often pose as representatives and exploit PWDs' vulnerabilities. To stay safe, PWDs should verify the recipient before sharing confidential information and be aware of different types of threats. They should avoid clicking on suspicious links or downloading applications from unknown sources. If victimized, PWDs should report the cyber attack. Organizations serving PWDs should also implement strong security measures, educate employees, and provide information to clients about cyber security.

title: SC is now more accessible with a sign language interpreter
article: disability rights advocates assert that the Supreme Court's decision to appoint a sign language interpreter will enhance inclusivity and accessibility within the judicial system. This move is seen as a commitment to ensuring that every voice is acknowledged, every word comprehended, and every right upheld.

title: New disability pension rules will prevent misuse: Chief of Defence Staff Anil Chauhan
article: The recent tightening of disability pension rules for the armed forces aims to prevent misuse and ensure a fitter military, according to Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan. The revised rules, which will be applicable to personnel retiring after September 21, 2023, do not affect the emoluments of war widows, family pensioners, or veterans.

title: MNREGA provides jobs to 1,057 disabled workers in U'khand, Uttarkashi leads with 309 registered workers
Accessibility & inclusion: AI for people with disabilities
Hindi film mocks disabled people, ban it, says govt panel
'Kilambakkam bus depot not disabled-friendly'
article: The new Kilambakkam bus terminus does not have basic accessibility requirements such as ramps, elevators and disabled-friendly toilets or doors, an accessibility audit by disability Rights Alliance (DRA), an NGO that works for the disabled, has found.

title: Cerebral palsy patient a doctor now: ‘It hasn’t got in my way’
Ration on doorstep for disabled kids
12-year-old girl with displaced spine bone saved from disability
disability rights activists demand an inclusive bus terminus
Udhampur couple gets life for killing disabled nephew
CM has failed to provide funds for govt schemes: Bhanot
Help disabled participate in judicial proceedings: HC
article: Delhi High Court has ordered the government to provide infrastructure and financial assistance to procure essential gadgets so that persons with disabilities can participate in court proceedings.

title: With 260 new terms 'Indian Sign language' enables communication on banking, bonds and trade
article: The Indian government has included 260 signs of financial terms in the Indian Sign Language (ISL) to help deaf and hearing impaired individuals understand and communicate about topics like bonds, equities, and financial markets. The ISL dictionary currently has 10,000 terms and aims to reach 30,000 terms in the future. The inclusion of financial terms in ISL is expected to benefit deaf individuals working in the financial and banking sectors and improve their employment prospects. The project was developed in collaboration with Societe Generale and v-shesh, with input from deaf individuals and financial experts. Additionally, an online self-learning course in ISL was launched to help bridge the communication gap between the hearing impaired and those who can hear.

title: Inclusive participation advocated for RG Marathon 3.0 by Goa disabilities advisory committee member
article: A member of the advisory committee of the Goa state commissioner for persons with disabilities is seeking participation of specially-abled people in the RG Marathon 3.0 scheduled to be held on October 1.

title: Tamil Nadu to take census of disabled people
Man with disability battered to death with a brick in Gurgaon
Joy and despair at job fair for people with disabilities
article: A job fair for persons with disabilities organised by Samarthanam Trust for the Disabled proved a success on Monday with more than one hundred candidates being shortlisted for employment in companies such as Amazon, Flipkart, Kotak and IBM.

title: Home voting: Over 12,000 elderly and disabled voters cast votes for Rajasthan assembly polls
article: Over 12,000 elderly and disabled voters in Jaipur, Rajasthan have cast their votes in the first phase of home voting for the assembly elections. These voters, who are aged above 80 or have disabilities, are eligible to vote from their homes. The Election Commission has sent special polling teams to record their votes in postal ballots in complete secrecy. A total of 62,927 voters in the state have applied for home voting. Voting will continue through postal ballots until November 19.
